result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Roman Pinedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 21 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONSECUTIVE to 15CF659.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Beth C or any other person prohibited by the agent, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Deft may have contact with Tina M when in prison setting; during extended supervision it is up to the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No relationships with women other than approved by the agent.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant in custody, by phone, w/ Attorney C Ward, by phone. Clerk/H. Barnett. Issue of Atty Ward's motion to withdraw. Court advises deft that once Atty Ward withdraws there will be no other public defender appointed. Deft states he spoke with Atty Ward and that she will not be withdrawing. Atty Ward withdraws motion to withdraw. Court voids order allowing Atty Ward to withdraw.
With Tina/New Lisbon Correctional Institution a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the FPT on 1/10/18 at 1:15pm.
With Atty Ward the motion to withdraw is scheduled for a phone appearance on 1/18/18 at 1:15pm.
Atty. Ward is allowed to withdraw as counsel.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lambrechts.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court amends order that the deft may have contact with Tina M. when in prison setting; during extended supervision it is up to the agent.
Handwritten credit calculation.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lambrechts.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP consecutive to 15CF659:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 21 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP.  No contact with Beth C. or Tina M. or any other person prohibited by agent.  No relationships with women other than approved by the agent.
With Atty Lambrechs and Amy/ADA Drees the SEHR of 3/31/17 at 9:30am is rescheduled, as the deft was not writted from Dodge Correctional; reset to 4/11/17 at 8:30am.
With Atty Lambrechts the SEHR of 3/22/17 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Lambrechts has a conflict; reset to 3/31/17 at 9:30am.
Revocation packet.
At the request of DOC Agt Patricia Bey a SEHR is set for 3/22/17 at 1:15pm.
Copy from file 14CF328 to be used for sentencing.  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 15 months w/conditions; credit for 21 days served if revoked; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.
With Atty Komp and by agreement of ADA Delgado the SEH of 7/5/16 at 2pm is rescheduled, as Atty Komp will need time to go over all the sentencing materials with deft; reset to 7/7/16 at 10am.
Probation update, by DOC Agt Patricia Bey.
E-mailed DOC Agent Patricia Bey requesting letter update.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J. Fields Bowers.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  On state's motion the enhancer possession of a controlled substance on or near certain places is dismissed. The deft pleads guilty; court finds the deft guilty.  Court to review PSI from file 14CF328 and obtain update on how deft is doing on probation.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/5/16 @ 2:00.  Bond continued.
Atty J. Fields Bowers requested adjournment of FPT on 5/24/16 @ 8:45 as he has a scheduling conflict.  Reset to 6/15/16 @ 9:00.
With Atty Komp the FPT of 3/22/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft's ATR will not be done until mid-April or mid-May; reset to 5/24/16 at 8:45am.
With Atty Komp and by agreement of ADA Delgado the FPT of 2/11/16 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as the deft is in an ATR to do Options, which is a 90-120 day program; reset to 3/22/16 at 8:30am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
for Bail/Bond Modification.

961.41(3g)(am) - Poss of narcotic drugs, repeater on or near certain places.

Defendant Jerry Roman Pinedo appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond modification motion filed; State does not object to motion being heard today.  Court modifies the bond to a signature bond of $5000.00 with the same conditions.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:45 am.
